meetingStructure.title: Opening & Welcome
meetingStructure.officialDescription: The President or designated officer opens the meeting, welcomes members and guests, and conducts any necessary club business.
meetingStructure.ourInterpretation: This is where we set the tone for the evening. The President welcomes everyone, introduces any first-time guests, and handles quick administrative items like announcements.

meetingComponents.title: Prepared Speeches
meetingComponents.description: We aim to have 3 speeches at every meeting, giving members regular opportunities to practice and improve. Members request speech slots through EasySpeak based on their Pathways projects.

meetingComponents.title: Speech Evaluations
meetingComponents.description: Each prepared speech receives constructive feedback from an assigned evaluator, helping speakers understand their strengths and areas for growth.

meetingComponents.title: Table Topics
meetingComponents.description: Impromptu speaking practice where members respond to surprise questions, building confidence in thinking on their feet.

meetingComponents.title: Meeting Roles
meetingComponents.description: Every meeting includes roles such as:
meetingComponents.notes: All members are encouraged to participate in roles to develop leadership and organizational skills.

features: Request speech slots for Pathways projects
Update speech titles and workbook assignments

bestPractices.speechFrequencyReason: Regular practice is the best way to progress through Pathways
tips: Give a speech every 2-3 meetings for regular practice
Take on different meeting roles to develop various skills
Provide speech slots in advance so evaluators can prepare
Update your workbook assignments in EasySpeak after completing speeches
Arrive by 6:30pm so we can start on time
bestPractices.competitiveAdvantage: Larger clubs don't offer as many speaking opportunities as we do. Take advantage of the regular chances to speak and practice!

whatToExpect.description: Our meetings are designed to help you develop your communication and leadership skills in a supportive and encouraging environment. Whether you're a first-time guest or a seasoned member, you'll find valuable opportunities to learn and grow.
activities: Prepared speeches by members working on their Pathways projects
Table Topics session for impromptu speaking practice
Constructive evaluations to help speakers improve
Role opportunities to develop leadership skills
Networking and fellowship with fellow members
